content.detailedDescription:
1) we were comming home from church
2) impossible not to see
3) wasn't sure it was larger than anything i ever seen
4) it was a cylinder in the middle with two spheres at each end with windows the length of the cylinder and around the end of the spheres. it looked like the color of the old glow in the dark frisbees. when we stopped the object got dim and almost transparent then quickly move away from us. we were about 500 ft from it and the building it was hovering over was an old folks home and it was half again bigger than the building which is about 250 ft. long.
5)i was completely confused while looking at te object just trying to figure it out. my mother was with me in the car and was extremely upset and just wanted me not to stop but leave asap. it is just a feeling of seeing something that large and that close to us and not being able to recognise what is it. i have never seen anything before and since that day. my mother is 84 yrs. old and hasn't been very talkative about until reciently and i think it maybe because of her religious beliefs. we got home about a mile from the sighting and the radio scanner was going crazy with reports of a ufo in the area. it was just something we didn't talk about after that but the questions are still with me and it's just something i can't forget. i was 16 at the time and since my mther pretty much wanted to forget about it i really never brought it up.
6) the object just quickly moved away and was lost behind the hills.
content.summary: Looked like a dumb bell shape large

content.detailedDescription: Was sitting at camp fire when we saw the orb and then saw 3 or 4 f-16 fighterjets follwing the orbthe orb went out of site then about 5 minutes later came back the other direction with out the jets following thats about what we saw
content.summary: Orb followed by f16 fighter jets

content.detailedDescription: Driving home with my girlfriend and noticed tothe right of me and seen above the trees there was a glow. and from that glow u could hear and see elecrical energy being exseted and used.
content.summary: Felt like it was taking electrical energy from everything

content.detailedDescription:
Went i saw this it was flying from north to south and it stop for
about a min and then it start fly again and i took 16 pictures that all i know
content.summary: I'm not sure what this is

content.detailedDescription: My niece, my son's girlfriend, and i were walking out of neighborhood walmart on feb. 25, 2012 (saturday night).  it was about 8:30pm and i looked up in the sky, towards the south and saw a red orange object traveling at a high rate of speed, heading north.  it almost looked as if it was an airplane on fire as it shot across the sky.  i was in awe looking at it, and said to my niece, "look at that fireball in the sky, what in the world is that?"  she couldn't believe it either!  we watched it race all the way across the black sky.  my son's girlfriend was already in the truck, and she noticed us looking up at the sky and said, "what are yall looking at?"  then she looked up and saw it race by.  we are not sure what it was?  it could have been a meteor?  space debris?  space ship?  we did not hear it, it wasn't making any noise but it was bright, looking like a fireball burning as it flew by.  it burned out after watching it for about 20 seconds.  it flew all the way across the sky flying at a high rate of speed coming from the south and burning out in the north towards oklahoma.  really wild!  found a few posts on the internet of people that had also wittnessed it.  wittnesses from houston all the way to oklahoma city saw it!
content.summary: Walking out of walmart on saturday night, i saw a burning ball of flames traveling at a high rate of speed!

content.detailedDescription: I was inside my house waiting with some friends for the ufc fight to start. i was called out to the back yard by my mother and father that are visiting. as i came out to look at what they were talking about i saw a dark object hovering motionless in the sky.  i immediately thought to myself that this object should not be in the sky and what could this possible be? i ran in and grabbed my camera and started to film. because of the time of day and the fact the this sun was going down it was very hard to focus on. i tracked it in the sky as long as i could before it got too dark.
content.summary: Solid object that was very dark. hovered in the sky for a time and then began to move slowly across the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
At 7:45pm, i took the dog outside to take care of business before settling down to watch tv at 8:00. it was a very clear night and the sky was full of stars. i observed a bright yellow/orange "star" in the western sky. it caught my attention because of the color. as we walked along, i noticed that the object was actually moving from west to east. by 7:50, it was now directly overhead. it made no noise but it seemed to pulsate and it would get brighter then dim. it reminded me of a satellite but it traveled too slow to be a satellite. i noticed that the dog was now aware of the object and he started to bark at it. 
some neighbors were walking by i pointed it out to them. they too were puzzled by its color and we all observed its pulsating feature. we concluded that it was not an aircraft since it had no white/red/or green lights on it like typical aircraft. 
i went inside an got my spotting scope to get a better view of the object. through the scope it looked like a slow moving fireball. it got really bright then it dimmed and disappeared. it came back for a few seconds then it was gone.
content.summary: Observed bright yellow/orange starlike object traveling from west to east.Moved very slow as high as a passenger jet. light got real bright, then seemed to fizzle away.

content.detailedDescription: I had been up all night watching tv and studying for an upcomming job. it was about 5:25 in the morning and i decided to go outside and have my last cigarette and then go to bed. as usual im lookin at the sky and right over my house i see this , basically a moving star. but when i say over my house i don't mean literally. i mean this thing was so high up it had to have been upper atmosphere or space i don't know. any way it was moving very fast and didn't have any blinking lights. it just looked like a star moving at a very high rate of speed. it went in a total straight path and i watched it literally until i couldn't see it anymore. it didn't dissapear, it just flew so far away that i couldn't see it anymore. im not saying this was an et craft, but it was definitely an unidentified flying object. the thing that stands out is the speed. as its passing im expecting to hear some type of sonic or sound barrier related noise. but nothing. no noise. just very, very,very, fast. straight path.... thats all.
content.summary: Airplane like path but definitely not an airplane known to me or the public

content.detailedDescription:
Around summer of 2002, i was on the back porch of my (now) ex-mother-in-law's home, looking southward. it was getting dark and to the south west, a golden yellow light (perfectly rounded, not jagged or fuzzy) slowly appeared. it was joined by between 6 and 7 other lights over just a few minutes, at different positions, in a line but not perfectly straight.
after a few minutes the lights had fully reached their maximum brightness, then one by one, starting with the first light to appear, began to move in separate directions. they would make sharp, deliberate turns and change direction, but didn't intersect each other's paths. they moved slowly but consistently as they went, never stopping, jerking or accelerating/decelerating. there was also no noise. they faded out before reaching any horizons or background structure which would have covered them from view.
at the time, my ex-in-law looked at me and told me if i said anything, she'd deny she was there when it happened. she never talked to me about it again, even denying it in front of my ex-wife when i mentioned something had happened outside.
i hadn't given it much thought since then, until i joined the army in 2009. i have seen dozens of different aircraft since then and flares in combat zones. nothing i have seen comes close to what i saw that night. i do not believe they were helicopters (too quiet and stable, wrong light setup) or plane (held position perfectly without drift).
last year i reviewed a documentary online of lights in the sky. other than not moving in a similar pattern, the footage was identical to what i saw that night, down to the same golden yellow glowing color. to date i have never heard of anything else being reported from that time, but then again i have only looked online and not in-depth.
content.summary: Lights move randomly

content.detailedDescription: I was out side in my front yard  calling my kids at around dark and just happened to look  to the west and i saw a pinkish red orb silently crossing the sky  and went down behind the treeline a few miles away.At first i thought it was fireworks but it left no trail behind it, there was no trail of smoke or light emitting from behind the object, i heard no sounds coming from it. i was really puzzled because i have never seen anything like it before.
content.summary: It was a pinkish red orb that emitted no sound

content.detailedDescription: Driving home from work with my girlfriend. the light. shooting star. cone flash, way to big to be a shooting, that shot right then made an immediate right angle turn, which i've never seen a shooting star do. freaked out and scared, especially after how pale my girlfriends face was when i went to ask her if she saw it. the object seemed to leave the atmosphere.
content.summary: Cone flash that shot right then made an immediate right angle turn

content.detailedDescription: I was outside taking pictures of the sky.  later i observed a black dot in this picture.  when i enlarged it the black dot seems to have an aura. this is the first i have observed. the dot is in area near where the sun is behind the clouds.
content.summary: Was taking pictures of sky later observed a dot in the image.

content.detailedDescription: A large, silent...(triangular formation of floating, gliding lights with no apparent mass, characterized by a circle of blinking red and white lights around the triangle?) passed above pleasant hill, california. whatever was moving the lights made no sound. whatsoever. what followed in the hour to come was a series of similar lights moving from roughly west to (northish) east. flying over where i would estimate the cemetery on reliz valley road to be, and moving towards gregory, over pleasant hill park, and onward towards concord. other arrangements of lights making absolutely no sound whatsoever and pulsating a rhythmic series of red and white flashes, along with some stationary blues and whites and golds. i lost count, but i can confidently say upwards of 12 light groups passed by. they all had slightly different shapes, but they made the same slow, steady trajectory, distinctly lower than an airplane's altitude. there was absolutely no other air traffic. no atmospheric rumblings of planes. no buzzes of helicopters. only a series of light groups, following behind each other in staggered gaps of time ranging from 2 minutes to 12 minutes. they moved slow and steadily, like a stone dropping through water; except horizontally through the air. many of them nearly went directly over my roof. i ran into my house after standing on my lawn for over an hour watching this take place. activity stopped probably around midnight (or perhaps one straggler after that time).  on a personal note, i felt a non-threatening, if not peaceful, "vibe". although there were moments of pure adrenaline and uncertainty.
content.shape: Circle,   Disc,   Flash,   Oval,   Sphere,   Star-like,   Triangle,   Unknown
content.summary: A slow-moving procession of 12 light groups in the sky making no noise.

content.detailedDescription: My mother and i were going to restaurant where my mother had an appointment at a restaurant at 11:30 am. about 3 miles from my home just before we had to make a right turn to the restaurant i saw in front of us a luminous light that was slowly moving to our left at about 2 mph, and about 120 feet away.  it would flash at times seemingly from the sun.  it had a moon shaped object about 3 feet from it that was also white, and half the size as the main part, and it did not flash.  the main part that flashed had no particular shape, as it looked roundish on some corners, and kind of squarish.  when my mother made a right turn as soon as we saw it for about a minute we realized it was gone.  no conventional aircraft could have vanished that fast.  thank you.
content.shape: Disc,   Flash,   Oval,   Sphere,   Square,   Rectagular,   Other
content.summary: Object seen by my mother and me while driving

content.detailedDescription: I can safely say that right now, fort wayne, in is the leading ufo "hotspot" in the world. i have seen what most would call "ufos" on a regular basis since 2004. there appears to be at least 3 different shapes or "kinds" of ufos in the sky at any given time. some appear to be solid objects moving silently and swiftly, while others only appear to be made of pure energy, like balls of light, that can pop up like a shooting star. family and friends of mine have also witnessed this as well. the fact that this has taken place for such a long period of time is the reason i am contacting mufon. im 27, male, and currently back in school working on my general eduacation degree. i have seen ufos on a regular basis since i was 19, but have kept quiet about my situation since the first year of my repeated sightings. i dont want to be known as the weird ufo guy. i do feel that i am witnessing one of the most important and groundbreaking events in human history though, and im finally deciding to do something about it. i feel i need to share this information about my experiences with the right people who will respect its importance, and can hopefully get a better understanding of ufos and extra-terrestrials in general. nothing i have seen on tv or read in books can compare to my experiences these past 8 years, and im pretty sure im doing the right thing by contacting mufon. my situation is extremely real, and extremely serious. a revolutionary event is currently happening, and i feel i need to do my part. if you i could get in contact with someone at mufon about my situation i would greatly appreaciate it. thanks for providing this open service. i feel that if i dont share this information to people who take ufos and extra-terresrtials seriously i would regret it. please contact me!
content.summary: Ufos in fort wayne, in

content.detailedDescription:
I really don't know who to tell this to. i'm not exactly sure if it even qualifies as a ufo event... but i thought that this  might be the best place. 

first of all, i have no history of blackouts, head injury, or any medical condition that would cause loss of memory. i awoke roughly around 1:49pm after nothing more than a night at home working on a scale model... i got out of bed, and shuffled into the living room, turning on the television and pc as is my normal routine on my days off. i saw down sitting straight up on the couch around 1:54pm, a few seconds later it appeared at glance than the program skipped a scene or two. i found that sort of odd, but i wasn't really paying attention because i was thinking of things i needed to buy for my modeling. but i then looked down at the clock on the cable box to find that it was now after 2pm! i thought that the cable company made some kind of error, until i checked my phone, alarm clock, and pc... all saying the same time. almost 2:05pm. i had almost 10 minutes of missing time! i'm not sure what to do with this... i don't remember anything unusual, besides the scene skip that i wasn't paying a great deal of attention too... 

once i started thinking about it more, i started remembering abduction stories i have heard, and reports of missing time. where the victims claim to remember nothing out of the ordinary, infact, don't seem to realize anything even happened, but somehow missing minutes, and even hours... 

can anyone bring any light to this? i have no idea what to make of it.
content.summary: Missing time - possible abduction

content.detailedDescription: Been seeing these orange lights for about 4 years now. been about 6 months. but they've shown up 2 days in a row now. watched these lights come on and off for about 35 minutes, we had 40mph winds that night. these lights didn't move they would come on and go off. wasn't flares, pretty sure with 40mph sustained winds they would be blowing around. was perfectly clear out, saw no planes in the area. they would come on then go off then about 5-10 minutes later came on again, was always a different pattern. the most we saw at one time were 6 lights in the sky, 3 of the lights were in one part of the sky and the other 3 were in another part of the sky, they both formed the same pattern in the sky except they were mirror images of each other. while watching these lights but not at the same time we saw a very brief white flash in the sky almost directly over us. was nothing there to cause these flashes all we could see in the sky were stars. the flash happened twice.
content.summary: Orange lights & white flashes in the sky

content.detailedDescription: Ufo-like object dicovered while looking thru photos.
content.summary: I was looking thru picture files and discovered what looks like something flying across the sky. it appears to be emiiting a vapor trail, but its cone shape is unlike anything with which i am familiar.

content.detailedDescription: Me and a friend were walking up the road to his house around 6:40pm (it was dark outside) and came to rest at the top of the road for a bit. we sat there on top of some mail boxes, then my friend looked up and said "dude, what the heck is that?!". i saw it appear at the same time out of the corner of my eye, i saw a flame ball looking thing it appeared (kind of lit up) stationary or hovering in the valley between us and the mountain across the way, going slower than a plane, but traveling at a constant speed. it appeared much, much lower than a plane or helicopter should be traveling (and we don't have a flight path anywhere near us), traveled north east, and then dissapeard in mid air. it was orange, couldn't see any shape, because it was glowing, and hard to look at or focus on. it was weird, we couldn't see what landmark it was over, but it was between us and another mountain. we followed for about 1 minute to 2 minutes as it went behind a house and then continued to travel towards the langford/victoria area, and disappeared. both mine and my friends cell phones were not unlocking, they were frozen, and unfortunately i was unable to capture any video or pictures. we were extremely frightened and shaky for the rest of the night.
content.summary: Object was very bright (orange) and hard to look at directly, faded into appearance, hovered, traveled left, and stopped then disappeared

content.detailedDescription: Me and a friend were walking up the road to his house around 6:40pm (it was dark outside) and came to rest at the top of the road for a bit. we sat there on top of some mail boxes, then my friend looked up and said "dude, what the heck is that?!". i saw it appear at the same time out of the corner of my eye, i saw a flame ball looking thing it appeared (kind of lit up) stationary or hovering in the valley between us and the mountain across the way, going slower than a plane, but traveling at a constant speed. it appeared much, much lower than a plane or helicopter should be traveling (and we don't have a flight path anywhere near us), traveled north east, and then dissapeard in mid air. it was orange, couldn't see any shape, because it was glowing, and hard to look at or focus on. it was weird, we couldn't see what landmark it was over, but it was between us and another mountain. we followed for about 1 minute to 2 minutes as it went behind a house and then continued to travel towards the langford/victoria area, and disappeared. both mine and my friends cell phones were not unlocking, they were frozen, and unfortunately i was unable to capture any video or pictures. we were extremely frightened and shaky for the rest of the night.
content.summary: Object was very bright (orange) and hard to look at directly, faded into appearance, hovered, traveled left, and stopped then disappeared

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home (westbound) on the i-10 on the curve before the airport. there was a bright object in my field of view above the road to the left (it looked like it was above central phoenix - the box section that the i17 and the i10 make). at first i thought it was a comet or large meteorite, then i saw a second one near the first one which looked like it was going to hit the first one. then the 1st one made a sharp zag to the left. both continued to descend toward the ground (though still well above the skyline) and the trail died out. as the trail behind the objects went out they looked the same color as the sky - i could only see their outline, which was like an upside down teardrop. when the trail behind them had gone out completely one object made a sharp arc over the road to the right and was no longer visible behind the skyline and while i was watching that one i lost sight of the other.
content.summary: 2 comet-like lights that abruptly changed direction then disappeared behind the skyline

content.detailedDescription: Out in my dooryard about 8pm looking straight up at the little dipper. noted a white starlike blip moving almost due west near the little dipper's handle, thought it was a satelite at first. have seen many satelites, this moved much faster. live in a military operations area, have seen what i thought were f15s or f16s mock dogfighting at night, the blip seemed to move faster than they did. the object moved in a straight line, and i was about to walk down my driveway, when this object let off an extremely large white flash. in relative size, say the object was the size of a poppie seed, the white flash was the size of a pea. this flash lasted about 2 seconds, then the object returned to its original size and i lost it after a couple of more seconds. the reason why i'm reporting this is that i can't understand how such a small starlike object could emit such a huge circle of light. the diameter of the flash must have been hundreds of times that of the object, just doesn't make sense. have seen a couple of things in the skies in past as this area doesn't have alot of washout from street lights,etc. since i saw the first ufo, i always look at the stars. my reaction right after the sighting was pretty much "here we go again, another mystery." i am a person who hates unsolved mysteries. may sound silly, but when i went to sleep i had this like 10 act, extremely detailed dream. it involved being in a spacecraft with asian people, and we were visiting these fritz lang like cities revolving around these strange planets. we were in dire straits and i don't remember how the dream turned out. i would say the dream was part nightmare. i don't watch tv, read alot of non fiction, and haven't seen a fritz lang movies in 30 years. the dream has left me a little rattled. my girlfriend says maybe i shouldn't be looking up in the night sky too much anymore.
content.summary: Starlike blip moving pretty fast, let off extremely large flash, resumed course.

content.detailedDescription: Out in my dooryard about 8pm looking straight up at the little dipper. noted a white starlike blip moving almost due west near the little dipper's handle, thought it was a satelite at first. have seen many satelites, this moved much faster. live in a military operations area, have seen what i thought were f15s or f16s mock dogfighting at night, the blip seemed to move faster than they did. the object moved in a straight line, and i was about to walk down my driveway, when this object let off an extremely large white flash. in relative size, say the object was the size of a poppie seed, the white flash was the size of a pea. this flash lasted about 2 seconds, then the object returned to its original size and i lost it after a couple of more seconds. the reason why i'm reporting this is that i can't understand how such a small starlike object could emit such a huge circle of light. the diameter of the flash must have been hundreds of times that of the object, just doesn't make sense. have seen a couple of things in the skies in past as this area doesn't have alot of washout from street lights,etc. since i saw the first ufo, i always look at the stars. my reaction right after the sighting was pretty much "here we go again, another mystery." i am a person who hates unsolved mysteries. may sound silly, but when i went to sleep i had this like 10 act, extremely detailed dream. it involved being in a spacecraft with asian people, and we were visiting these fritz lang like cities revolving around these strange planets. we were in dire straits and i don't remember how the dream turned out. i would say the dream was part nightmare. i don't watch tv, read alot of non fiction, and haven't seen a fritz lang movies in 30 years. the dream has left me a little rattled. my girlfriend says maybe i shouldn't be looking up in the night sky too much anymore.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were driving south to salem oregon and we were about 15 miles out from salem when we observed the object on the opposite side of freeway interstate 5. it was moving northward approx 50-60 mph ( traffic was about 70 mph so object appeared to be slightly slower ). it changed direction sudden left towards the south bound lanes and came right over our car, approx 20-50 feet up at the most. i was passenger, wife driving, i turned in my seat to watch it fly right over the semi-truck behind us. totally clear and unobstructed view of tear-drop, in other words, smaller in back than in front. wife thought the front was shaped like a mushroom...Maybe, because it was larger than back end. no lights, no markings but there was some sort of darker rail-shaped apparatus hanging underneath it. for that reason i told my wife i believed it to be some sort of traffic control drone aircraft taking photos. it changed directions once behind us, veering to right, then to left and again each way. whatever it was it was really flying, not drifting. actually i'd have to say it was one of the sleekest beautiful aircraft i have ever seen. in the very beginning of his incident i do remember thinking it looked like a small blimp-balloon used by car dealerships and tethered to a small line on the ground and may have been momentarily stationary at that time, i just couldn't tell because it all happened in the course of 2-3 minutes and it moved along, crossing over us quickly as i mentioned above. i would really like someone to tell us what we saw if it is a known aircraft please.
content.summary: Dark dull larger in front than in back, thus teardrop but horizontally so

content.detailedDescription:
My wife son and i were taking a walk when i felt a strong compulsion to look directly overhead. i saw the first object which i first thought was a helium filled party balloon, but it strongly glowed and at the same time appeared solid. it moved slower than the prevailing wind and when it passed through a cloud i realized that it couldn't have been a baloon and still be seen. the cloud was neither all that thick, nor that large but as it entered the cloud it disappeared. before it disappeared its glow could be seen through the cloud and then the glos seemed to quickly diminish to nothing and disappear entirely. within minutes we saw another very bright orb, gestimated to be at least as high and very bright bluish white alternating to light yellowish white. the sun was still well in the sky (about 45degrees or more) and these orbs were still bright to the eyes. 

as with the first sighting, i had a compulsion to look up and again my eyes went straight to the orb without searching for it, as if in both cases i knew exactly where it was. this time my wife also immediately located it without searching for it as she did with the first one. we both watched as it hung in the sky. we first talked about the possibility of it being a star but quickly dismissed the thought owing to the position of the sun at the time. we were further convinced it was out of the ordinary when right before our eyes it sort of 'blinked out'. we searched the sky for where it might have gone, but it was not to be seen. 

we knew they must be high as not long after they disappeared a commercial jet flew overhead yet seemed close than the objects we saw. after the orbs disappeared i suddenly felt very drained and sleepy for an hour or so. this is to me noteworthy as i was not remotely tired before the event, not after the hour or so duration after the event, but when the event occurred my mind seemed to be hypersensitized.
content.summary: One yellow - orange and one blue/white to yellow/white orb over sydney

content.detailedDescription:
My wife son and i were taking a walk when i felt a strong compulsion to look directly overhead. i saw the first object which i first thought was a helium filled party balloon, but it strongly glowed and at the same time appeared solid. it moved slower than the prevailing wind and when it passed through a cloud i realized that it couldn't have been a baloon and still be seen. the cloud was neither all that thick, nor that large but as it entered the cloud it disappeared. before it disappeared its glow could be seen through the cloud and then the glos seemed to quickly diminish to nothing and disappear entirely. within minutes we saw another very bright orb, gestimated to be at least as high and very bright bluish white alternating to light yellowish white. the sun was still well in the sky (about 45degrees or more) and these orbs were still bright to the eyes. 

as with the first sighting, i had a compulsion to look up and again my eyes went straight to the orb without searching for it, as if in both cases i knew exactly where it was. this time my wife also immediately located it without searching for it as she did with the first one. we both watched as it hung in the sky. we first talked about the possibility of it being a star but quickly dismissed the thought owing to the position of the sun at the time. we were further convinced it was out of the ordinary when right before our eyes it sort of 'blinked out'. we searched the sky for where it might have gone, but it was not to be seen. 

we knew they must be high as not long after they disappeared a commercial jet flew overhead yet seemed close than the objects we saw.
content.summary: One bright orange to yellow the other bright whit to possible yellow orbs.

content.detailedDescription: I was on my way to work and where i live you can usually see the stars very well. when i walked outside i noticed an overcast and couldn't see the stars. as i was driving i noticed two lights. one appeared to be above the other but might not have been. i figured it was airplanes seeing that it was in the direction of the airport. shortly after, one light moved above the other as the other remained stationary. when i arrived at work i got out and looked at the lights and noticed no blinking lights and they were way to bright to be stars especially with an overcast. the lights eventually disappeared after 15 minutes. i don't necessarily think it was aliens or anything crazy, but it is definitely interesting.
content.summary: Two bright lights hovering

content.detailedDescription: Something woke me 2am in morning opened front of house and whitenessed object more than once several other things have happened around home at night house out in desert in tucson az.
content.summary: Red sphere ,silent traveling slow. 10 ft off ground

content.detailedDescription: It lloked like 3 rockets were launched into space at the same time. 3 objects in the western sky moved in unison from west to east an then disaperaed as if they were rockets flying into space. i've seen 1 rocket but not three at one time.
content.summary: 3 rockets

content.detailedDescription: We were at the 7mile bridge just before the sun set in the florida keys. we saw a jet fly over and we took a photo. as the sun neared being set i noticed a blak grayish spehere hovering to the right of the 7 mile bridge. i pointed it out to my husband. we waited and watched for 15 min or so to see if it was a blimp or helicopter but it never moved! after the sun had set ad there was still some light in the sky we walked back to the car, my husband decided to run behind a tree to relieve himself. when he returned he said the object was  still in the sky. this was maybe 8 minutes or so after watching it for 15 minutes earlier. darkness fell as we began to drive and whe we looked for the object we could no longer see it. the bridge was full of people but no one seemed to notice. i stopped a jogger passig by and asked him what he thought it was...He shrugged his shoulders and said he didnt know either. well i did get a few seconds on video ad i will upload it along with the photo of the plane.
content.summary: Black gray like sphere
